title: How to download a song I found on Youtube - Quora

response.answer_text: There are a lot of YouTube music-ripping websites out there, but they’re not all trustworthy. Here I would recommend a YouTube Music Downloader developed by TunesKit to you. TunesKit Audio Capture could help you download music from YouTube and convert YouTube music to MP3 or other formats with four steps. This tool could get the job done well. Just perform the following steps: Open TunesKit Audio CaptureSet the output audio formatPlay a music track from SpotifyBegin to record music from YouTubeFinally, you will get YouTube music with the original audio quality and listen to YouTube music without the distraction of ads even though you don’t have an Internet connection.

1] Open the video on youtube. 2] replace the word “youtube” from the link of the video (“http://www.youtube.com/xxxxxxx”) to “youmagictube”. It opens up a website called Save-Video. 3] Click on “Proceed”. There might be a pop-up window. So, close it. 4] Click on “Listen”. 5] Click on “Click to Continue” and then “Click here to start”. 6] Select “Save File” and then download the song.

You could copy and paste the YouTube link to the Download box on savefrom.net, or simply add ss before the YouTube link to see all available resolutions for a given video, from there you will get to see an option to download the video in Audio MP4 format. Do the same.  Or you could paste the YouTube video link to the Download box on keepvid.com and download the video in M4A format which will give you the required audio file.  Good Luck !

Okay, I am going straight to the point and tell you that, it is possible to download youtube music to your hard disc, but not directly, you may take a little bit detours if you care about the safety of your PC. The concern is also true of YouTube converters. So I am here to suggest you try a 3rd-party screen recorder - RecMaster to capture YouTube audios. With valid paid licenses, your benefits will be protected to the most degree. And beyond that, the screen recorder captures youtube videos effortlessly and you can choose the audio-only mode to capture YouTube music.

Yes… but there’s the right way and the wrong way. The right way is uncommon, that is to get YouTube Red, which costs money monthly, and download videos like that. The way most people do it is by simply going on your computer, searching YouTube to MP3 in Google, and using a website to convert it into the content. MP3 works if you just want audio. If you want the video screen as well, you can search YouTube to MP4, which includes video. The sites are sketchy, so make sure your computer and browser are safe before proceeding. Hope this helps.

Usually, copyrighted videos (and/or audios from those videos) cannot be used for personal or commercial use. However, there are videos that are copyright free. Look for videos with Creative Commons License. You can even use those videos in your own videos and monetize them. You can download the audio of any video (whether copyright protected or not) anyway as no one gets to know that you have those files. But this is not legal.

Normally it's regulated by the channel owner. So if they allow to download youtube videos it is normally stated in the description to the video. Another way to check that is to write to them directly and ask a permission. In all other instances, consider the video copyrighted unless this content belongs to the public by law. Downloading content for commercial use is not allowed in almost all cases. But this if of course my humble and strictly private opinion. If you have doubts, ask the lawyer.

You could use YouTube’s Premium feature, which allows you to download videos. But that wouldnt download the mp3 file. You can use any “YouTube to MP3” website. You import the link, and then you hit download. Pretty easy but I think it's illegal. You can search more about it.

Youtube45 ! When watching a youtube video, just add “45″ in the browser url after “youtube”  After hitting enter you will see this >>  Select the .m4a format as it is better than the mp3 format (m4a format was invented by Apple. Youtube also prefers .m4a over mp3) After clicking the download button, video will start playing in the browser Just “Cntrl + S” or Right click and “Save as” to save music to PC !

Just go to the link: http://www.youtube-mp3.org/    ​ and paste the URL of the song you want to download in the box below YouTube mp3 and click on convert video.  ​You will get a screen as shown above (ofcourse with the photo of the video which you want to convert).Then click on download. As simple as that.This site even works on mobile.Good luck.

Yes , its possible and very easy as well . The process to download audio is same as downloading video !! You simply have to add “to” just after youtube . For Example : Real Link : http://www.youtube.com/videourl After Adding “to” : http://www.youtubeto.com/videourl

It's simple,use snaptube app(this is not official in playstore) u have to download it from snaptube website.After download the app ,go to youtube app and select the required video and choose share option and it will show “download with snaptube” select it and it shows all the audio and video formats available.

The easiest way to download a Youtube song is to add ‘work’ in front of youtube in your URL. You will be directed to a download page where you can click Download Audio. A few seconds later and your song should be downloaded! An example of what I mean: https://www.workyoutube.com/watch?v=dQw4w9WgXcQ

You cannot download videos from YouTube unless the uploader has chosen a license that allows people to download it. If they have, there is a download button. If there is no button, YouTube does not permit downloads. Further, doing a download anyway would be illegal copyright infringement.

You can use an application called clipgrab, which you need to install in your computer. It is a open source application where you can choose whether you want to save the video or or the audio file, and you can choose from different formats.
